photo.description: PLEASE, no multi invitations in your comments. DO NOT FEEL YOU HAVE TO COMMENT.Thanks. The Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or "Fountain of the Four Rivers" is located in the Piazza Navona. Designed by Gianlorenzo Bernini, it is emblematic of the dynamic and dramatic effects sought by High Baroque artists. It was erected in 1651 in front of the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone, and yards from the Pamphilj Palace belonging to this fountain's patron, Innocent X (1644-1655). The four gods on the corners of the fountain represent the four major rivers of the world known at the time: the Nile, Danube, Ganges, and Plate. The design of each god figure has symbolic importance.
photo.tags: italy rome roma piazzanavona statues suare fountainofthefourrivers fontanadeiquattrofiumi stadiumofdomitian trafalgartours tour trafalgar canada d300 nikon 18200vr 70300mmvr archer10 dennis jarvis dennisgjarvis dennisjarvis free freepicture iamcanadian
photo.title: Italy-0141

photo.description: The Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi or "Fountain of the Four Rivers" is a fountain in Rome, Italy, located in the urban square of the Piazza Navona. It was designed in 1651 by Gian Lorenzo Bernini for Pope Innocent X. The base of the fountain is a basin from the centre of which travertine rocks rise to support four river gods and above them, an ancient Egyptian obelisk surmounted with the Pamphili family emblem of a dove with an olive twig.
photo.tags: rome italy autostitch
photo.title: The Fountain of the Four Rivers

Designed by Gianlorenzo Bernini, it is emblematic of the dynamic and dramatic effects sought by High Baroque artists. It was erected in 1651 in front of the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone, and yards from the Pamphilj Palace belonging to this fountain's patron, Innocent X (1644-1655). The four gods on the corners of the fountain represent the four major rivers of the world known at the time: the Nile, Danube, Ganges, and Plate. The design of each god figure has symbolic importance.

photo.description: Come se fosse normale affacciarsi al balcone, innaffiare i gerani e ritrovarsi sul faccione la "Fontana dei quattro fiumi", del Bernini... Just like it was a normal thing, in Italy, having a simple house, with flowers on your balcony. Then you look ahead and you find that at 20 meters you can look at Bernini's masterpiece: "La Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi". Obviously this is not a common place, it's Piazza Navona, in Rome.
photo.tags: roma rome fujis6000fd bernini piazzanavona
photo.title: Come se...

photo.description: Lion au pied de la grotte de la Fontaine des quatre fleuves (détail (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) Dessinée par le Bernin et sculptée par son école, cette fontaine située au centre de la "piazza Navona" est une oeuvre majeure du baroque romain. La fontaine comprend en son centre un obélisque inséré dans une grotte de rocaille évidée sur laquelle se tiennent les quatre allégories des fleuves (continents connus à l'époque) : Danube, Rio de la Plata, Gange, Nil.
photo.tags: dalbera rome italie roma italia italy piazzanavona lebernin fontaine lion
photo.title: Fontaine de la piazza Navona (Rome)

photo.description: La grotte de la Fontaine des quatre fleuves (détail) (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) Dessinée par le Bernin et sculptée par son école, cette fontaine située au centre de la "piazza Navona" est une oeuvre majeure du baroque romain. La fontaine comprend en son centre un obélisque inséré dans une grotte de rocaille évidée sur laquelle se tiennent les quatre allégories des fleuves (continents connus à l'époque) : Danube, Rio de la Plata, Gange, Nil.
photo.tags: dalbera anniedalbera roma rome italie italia italy piazzanavona lebernin fontaine grotte
photo.title: Fontaine de la piazza Navona (Rome)

photo.description: L'allégorie du Rio de la Plata de la fontaine des quatre fleuves (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) Dessinée par le Bernin et sculptée par son école en 1651, cette fontaine située au centre de la "piazza Navona" est une oeuvre majeure de ce célèbre artiste baroque. La fontaine comprend en son centre un obélisque (provenant du cirque de Maxence) inséré dans une grotte de rocaille évidée sur laquelle se tiennent les quatre allégories des fleuves (des 4 continents connus à l'époque) : Danube, Rio de la Plata, Gange, Nil.

photo.title: Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi by Bernini, Piazza Navona - Rome, Italy

photo.description: Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, Piazza Navona, Rome, Italy Fountain of Four River, Navona Square, Rome, Italy Piazza Navona is a city square in Rome, Italy. It follows the plan of an ancient Roman circus, the 1st century Stadium of Domitian, where the Romans came to watch the agones ("games"): It was known as 'Circus Agonalis' (competition arena). It is believed that over time the name changed to 'in agone' to 'navone' and eventually to 'navona'. Defined as a public space in the last years of 15th century, when the city market was transferred to it from the Campidoglio, the Piazza Navona is now the pride of Baroque Roman art history. It features sculptural and architectural creations by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, whose famous Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers, 1651) stands in the center; by Francesco Borromini and Girolamo Rainaldi, who designed the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone; and by Pietro da Cortona, who painted the galleria in the Pamphilj palace. The market was again moved in 1869 to the Campo de' Fiori. The piazza long hosted theatrical shows and horse races. From 1652 until 1866, when the festival was suppressed, it was flooded on every August Saturday and Sunday for elaborate celebrations of the Pamphilj family. The Piazza Navona contains two additional fountains, sculpted by Giacomo della Porta: the Fontana di Nettuno (1574), located at the northern area of the piazza; and the Fontana del Moro (1576), located at the southern end.
photo.tags: rome italy fountain piazza navona fontana dei quattro fiumi four rivers
photo.title: Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi, Piazza Navona, Rome, Italy

photo.description: Piazza Navona is a square in Rome. The piazza follows the plan of an ancient Roman circus, the 1st century Stadium of Domitian, where the Romans came to watch the agones ("games"). Defined as a square in the last years of 15th century, when the city market was transferred here from the Campidoglio, Piazza Navona is now the pride of Baroque Rome. It has sculptural and architectural creations: by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, the famous Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers, 1651) in the center; by Francesco Borromini and Girolamo Rainaldi, the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone; and by Pietro da Cortona, who painted the gallery in the Pamphilj palace.

photo.title: the reach

photo.description: L'allégorie du Gange de la fontaine des quatre fleuves (détail) (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) Dessinée par le Bernin et sculptée par son école en 1651, cette fontaine située au centre de la "piazza Navona" est une oeuvre majeure de ce célèbre artiste baroque. La fontaine comprend en son centre un obélisque (provenant du cirque de Maxence) inséré dans une grotte de rocaille évidée sur laquelle se tiennent les quatre allégories des fleuves (des 4 continents connus à l'époque) : Danube, Rio de la Plata, Gange, Nil.
photo.tags: dalbera anniedalbera roma rome italie italia italy piazzanavona lebernin fontaine allégorie legange
photo.title: Fontaine de la piazza Navona (Rome)

photo.description: L'allégorie du Gange de la fontaine des quatre fleuves (Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi) Dessinée par le Bernin et sculptée par son école en 1651, cette fontaine située au centre de la "piazza Navona" est une oeuvre majeure de ce célèbre artiste baroque. La fontaine comprend en son centre un obélisque (provenant du cirque de Maxence) inséré dans une grotte de rocaille évidée sur laquelle se tiennent les quatre allégories des fleuves (des 4 continents connus à l'époque) : Danube, Rio de la Plata, Gange, Nil.

photo.description: Piazza Navona was breath-taking in the daytime. The central fountain was gorgeous but I found when looking up the shapes created were amazing. I did darken this photo quite a bit to get to this stage but I thought it brought the small features more into view rather than being lost in the surfaces.
photo.tags: blackandwhite bw italy konica kd500z fontanadeiquattrofiumi fountainofthefourrivers rome piazzanavona square piazza obelisk egyptian danube nile ganges plate angelsanddemons fountain water contrast highcontrast blackwhitephotos
photo.title: Cultural Collide - Piazza Navona, Rome

photo.description: Piazza Navona is a square in Rome. The piazza follows the plan of an ancient Roman circus, the 1st century Stadium of Domitian, where the Romans came to watch the agones ("games"). Defined as a square in the last years of 15th century, when the city market was transferred here from the Campidoglio, Piazza Navona is now the pride of Baroque Rome. It has sculptural and architectural creations: by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, the famous Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers, 1651) in the center; by Francesco Borromini and Girolamo Rainaldi, the church of Sant'Agnese in Agone; and by Pietro da Cortona, who painted the gallery in the Pamphilj palace.
